caption: Very friendly service and delicious food 😋
Excellent staff and food
Absolutely the best italian we have had in Brooklyn and the prices are super reasonable. This is a true must try.
Delicious! Worth every penny. You must try this place. The Bolognese della Nonna is fantastic.

"Piccolo is a small Italian restaurant with outstanding food and service." "I especially enjoyed the seafood black squid pasta and grilled calamari ." "Delicious home-cooked Italian food, and friendly wait staff."

I went on Thursday, 2/25, horrible food, nasty waiter, food was not fresh and it had a burnt flavor/taste on everything. The waiter simply said to me this is how we cook it. You can tell the food was cooked on an unclean grill and I had the horrible pleasure of tasting the nasty, burnt grill, and the staff didn't seem to care at all. I will never go back.
Delicious!
Not impressed... Poor service, very BLAND food, soggy salads... BUT, the boneless chicken (appetizer) was pretty good... Lol
Perfect
This was one of the most affordable brunch places I have ever been to in New York and great food as well. Small restaurant but with a decent variety of dishes. Great service

Other than the annoying E-Harmony first date couple at a nearby table (the woman sounded like Fran Drescher!) the meal was as good as can be expected for outside dining. The black pasta is truly unique and delicious, and the waiter's recommended shrimp and chorizo in marinara was spot on for a cold rainy night. The dolci was perfectly proportioned but delectably decadent. Pricing was more than fair, and the service attentive. I'd have loved to have seen a couple NY State wines on the menu. But no complaints on anything that is within the control of the management and staff. Now to get our IDIOT bureaucrats to allow indoor dining, as I had just a few miles away last night in NJ, and all will be good.
Great spot, I always get the spaghetti granchio- black spaghetti with blue crab meat and scallions. Really delicious
Very enjoyable. Heat lamp was great, kept us totally warm. Food was amazing. Service was great. Definitely going back again.

One of my favorite places to eat, EVER! I always order the butternut squash ravioli AND the squid ink chorizo and shrimp pasta dish because I can never decide between them. This place never disappoints and the service is always wonderful.
Overall good. Decent pasta. No for the tiramisu: I got home and feel sick🤮
Best

We arrived at this spot for a meeting. This place was recommended to us by a friend.  Well, we were not disappointed. The crew were very polite and we felt very good. The meal was fresh and delicious. We loved this place very much and we shall definitely come back again. Highly recommended.

Exceptional food in the neighborhood. Before the world ended, I was fortunate enough to dine in and enjoy the ambience as well as my dinner. These days, we end up ordering delivery every couple of weeks and I cannot get enough of the gnocchi. I’ve had a few different things from Piccoli but the gnocchi has wound up being the thing that I crave. They’re so tender and flavorful and the mozzarella is perfect.  We’ve had a few different dishes and they’ve all been exceptional. Fast delivery, too.
Love this place...hands down the best pasta dishes around Park Slope! Great attentive staff...
Been a few times and everything has always been delicious, with lovely wait staff and service. One of our favorite date night spots.
Food was not good. Service was great, but the food lacked flavor. Was not impressed.
They have some great outdoor seating now - which is also sheltered from the wind.  The service is great and the risottos (especially squash one) are lovely.

Stopped by early on a Sunday after having breakfast elsewhere; needed ‘dessert.’ This place is amazing! The manager was the friendliest and he was very accommodating and willing to answer all the questions that my date had about the restaurant (and its history!). Didn’t order any main meals but the menu was very expansive — lots of delicious options. I also loved that it was a digital menu...“scan me” was taped to the table. I had the tiramisu (loved!!) with a cappuccino and my date had the olive cake and an espresso. Everything was fresh and made from scratch. My date claimed that his cake wasn’t  “olivey” enough (for him) but it was still good. Overall, would definitely return for a full course and also recommend to others.  (Oh, and lots of outdoor seating during COVID)

I dine in this place quite often! This is the best place to grab a bite.  I visit this place many times. The meals are just great, the workers are welcoming and the rates are reasonable. I enjoy eating in this place to have a decent dinner.
Terrific good and exceptional service.
I’ve been going to Picollis with my wife for years as it is her favorite restaurant ! The food is A+ the grilled calamari is a must try !

This place is OUTSTANDING!! My wife is still raving about the black spaghetti and shrimp and the chocolate cake as well. I had the chicken panini sandwich and I didn't want to talk it was so good.  Reasonable prices, outdoor dining and a great place to go with friends, or just by yourself. My wife and I will definitely be back

We read the reviews and got a recommendation from our hotels front desk to try Picolli. It did not disappoint. We were taken care of by Jose who provided prompt and courteous service. He was attentive to all details and conscientious.  He recommended the Chicken Parm which my husband had and was very satisfied with it. I had the Chicken Marsala which was excellent as well.  Everything was clean and well sanitized. We visit Manchester a few times a year and this will become our go to Italian restaurant.
Food was pretty good, nothing great. Squid ink risotto was BOMB. Service is excellent, ambiance it's lovely. Overall pretty good, not great.
So delicious. Great vibes and amazing food.
Just a no drama mixture of delicious food and attentive service. Covid attentive. Great atmosphere. I went with Brooklyn Italians and they loved it, too.
Wonderfu food, fairly priced... staff is friendly and attentive....
Calm atmosphere, staff are attentive and kind. Food is delicious!!! My new favorite spot.
High quality, freshly prepared Italian and Italian-inspired dishes and reasonable prices. Their specialty is risotto, so don’t sleep on that.
Excellent dinner with sidewalk seating. Highly recommended!
Omg this food was amazing
Yummy food and great service

Came across this cute cozy restaurant while taking a stroll and decided to try their food . The cocktails were fabulous and risotto was so homely and delicious . Last but not the least tiramisu was more than perfect .

Day speaken Italian like  AAYYYY BIBIDY BOBODY! LETS-A-COMMIT ORGANIZED CRIME!  Ok, in all seriousness, I found the food to be pretty good and I thought the place had a pleasing aesthetic. The food didn't take too long in the waiters were pretty friendly, but I didn't get to meet super Mario so it's not really Italian.
Yummy! So good, you won't be disappointed!

This place is great! The food came out piping hot and they were super knowledgable and accommodating on suggestions and alterations. Service was a little slow, but I think that was due to figuring out the new normal of streetside dining. I'll be back- this is a neighborhood gem.
Delicious brunch, great service, and reasonably priced. Highly recommend.
Great food, awesome staff
Never disappoints!
Some of the best Italian in the neighborhood. The pappardelle is phenomenal, as well as the brussel sprouts.
I really love the dishes and customer service, great location next to where I live. The employees are always super friendly. Would recommend to others.

I saw the reviews today on Yelp and made a decision to take my family for a quick dinner.  Well they did not disappoint. Amazing customer service by all staff, food was delicious.  I highly recommended this restaurant.
Great tasting brunch, Great attentive service! We've been here about 10 times — always a quality & enjoyable experience.

Truly had one of the best meals I've ever had here. We went all out and got an appetizer, wine, entrees, dessert, AND espresso, and let me tell you - it.was.all.amazing. Moreover, the atmosphere is lovely. I felt like I just stepped into a little trattoria in the 40s for the evening. I can't wait to go back!
Food is excellent and the service was great!
Reasonable prices, good wine, and great homemade pasta! I recommend the black ink spaghetti.
Great spot for a casual brunch or a nice, romantic dinner

What a cozy and lovely neighborhood Italian restaurant!  It has some Mediterranean overtones which was lovely.  Service was kind and attentive.  Beer and wine only -- fills up fast so I recommend reservations.  Favorites were the calamari and the steak (the potatoes that come with the steak was maybe the absolute favorite).
One of the best meals I've ever had. If you can afford it, get the tasting menu and buckle in for an amazing experience. Service is phenomenal.

I love this place so much. Staff are exceptionally warm and they genuinely seem happy. Food is excellent, creative, and fairly priced. On a recent evening they were playing Rufus Wainwright, which really sold me! Bonus: Sauvignon Blanc, Torrontes, AND falaghina all by the glass. Amazing!
Very good and tasty food
EXCELLENT FOOD!!!!

Wait was a bit busy, and I actually got the wrong dish given to me, but only noticed after the fact because it was so delicious! Definitely coming back to try the other dish though!  Not very expensive either!
Mushroom risotto  and the polenta are two delicious dishes!  Highly recommend!

Lovely neighborhood restaurant with delicious food. Came here on a Tuesday evening. The restaurant was half empty but filled up very quickly. When our food arrived we realized why so many people were coming in on a weekday.  Everything was delicious and flavorful! We ordered the farro salad and the calamari for appetizers and seafood risotto and duck for dinner. Loved everything! Even took an order of the short rib pappardelle home for our son. He loved it too and now wants to come back to try the restaurant.  The best part was that the bill was very reasonable! We will definitely be back.

Best to have a reservation or come early Small restaurant with Windows overlooking the street.  Fills up after 7:00 pm so best to make a reservation.   Menu with a good selection of antipasti, primi e secondi piatti.  Balance of seafood/ meat/meatless mains.  Great olive oil cake for dessert.
This place is a find! Fettuccine was to die for!!!
Friendly staff and amazing food
An amazing meal!

(Translated by Google) The ambience and atmosphere is very good. The presentations are incredible. Everyone should come and see ..  (Original) Das Ambiente und die Atmosphäre ist sehr gut. Die Präsentationen sind unglaublich. Jeder sollte kommen und sehen ..
(Translated by Google) A few words, delicious food, friendly simulated staff  (Original) Poche parole, cibo squisito, personale simatico cordiale
Food is always good even if you go at the to go place , The restaurant itself is very small and service is just ok
Great food and service. A little jewel in Parl Slope.

Really enjoyed this place. Very nice cozy atmosphere. Great service and amazing food. We’ve ordered calamari antipasto and the dish is simply top notch. Pastas and risotto are delicious. Will definitely come here again.
Great food and atmosphere
Had grilled calamari and black pasta with blue crab, both excellent!

This was our first time dining at Piccoli and I was really disappointed in the service. We made an 8:00pm reservation for Saturday night and arrived 10 minutes early. We were told our table was finishing up and so we waited...and waited...and waited. We watched other parties sit, so we inquired with the hostess, and the hostess admitted her mistake. She promised we would be seated by 8:30pm. If only she has been upfront and honest about how long things were really going to take. We could have walked around or gone elsewhere for a drink. Instead, we continued to wait. We finally sat a little after 9pm in between two other couples. We all ordered from the waitress at the same time. The comedy of errors continued. The tables next to us were paying their check when we were served our meal (a little after 10:00pm). The rigatoni a la norma was delicious, but definitely not worth the hassle. The host offered free drinks and dessert, but at that point, we just wanted to eat and leave. We were offered 50% off our bill. Maybe a weeknight is a better time to dine (when it’s not as busy). I would not eat here again.

My daughter came here once and thought it was a hidden gem so we had to go together.  Food was okay.  When we paid the bill my daughter noticed that a 20 percent tip after tax was added in.  Hmmmm.  I thought this was usually only added in for parties of 6 or more and that’s what the menu said.  When I had to add the tip on the electronic device I added no tip.  A bus person asked how I liked the restaurant and I said I thought it was terrible.  A young lady who assumed a tone of authority came over and I explained why I would never recommend this restaurant and go ahead and give it a lousy  review.  I don’t like sneaky.   She apologized but I really felt it was not genuine.  They knew exactly what they were doing.  So here is my bad review.  We went to a cocktail bar after that my daughter’s friend manages and told her what happened.  She agreed it’s bs bc it is programmed into the registered in a way I can’t explain when a tip should be included.
Delicious food and great staff. Plan on coming back for sure. Their pasta selection is the best in the neighborhood.

Love love love the place !!! My boyfriend and I go there all the time They have amazing food great service and lovely vibe ! Very friendly and smiley service every time we go ! Can't get enough from this restaurant really! Go there at least once a month Highly recommended!
Amazing Italian food !! The ravioli is incredible the cauliflower as well !
Quality food, Quality service
Fantastic food and lovely friendly service. Well done team .
Super tasty pasta spot in the hood.
Best Gnocchi I ever had!
Steak with chimichurri is my favorite
Awesome food love it highly recommended

Having lived in the area for several years, I always pass this place and put it on my mental list of "restaurants to try" but had never stepped inside until last night.  I am kicking myself for not coming here sooner.  The food is INCREDIBLE, the ambiance is beautiful, and the service is personable.  As a vegetarian, there were several and varied items on the menu that met my dietary restrictions.  The meals are perfectly portioned and seasoned - I particularly enjoyed the polenta/mushroom appetizer and the fettuccine pasta.  The meals are clearly home-cooked and carefully created.  We finished up with the tartufo and it was incredible.  I can't wait to go back!  The wait staff clearly enjoy their jobs; they are friendly and personable.  Seems like Piccoli gets many regulars - the waitresses were able to identify their customers by name and check in about their lives.  As we were leaving, the waitress had overheard we were celebrating a birthday and had given us a piece of tiramisu to-go.  It was a sincere and kind touch.  Overall 10/10 experience.  This will be the place we take all of our guests/family/friends when they come in from out of town!
Authentic Italian comfort food including an amazing risotto selection!  I need to try everything on the menu

I love the fact that the bodega I grew up buying heros and quarter juices from is now one of my favorite restaurants in Brooklyn. The fact that it's right down the block from my house is also a plus. The place can get packed and a little hectic and people in this neighborhood are extremely demanding. There are only a couple people working the front of house so on a busy day bare with them. Food is always consistent and if you order the polenta and shrimp make sure to order 2 poached eggs. I've eaten everything on the menu. The pork chop is so good. You know what I'm getting hungry writing this review!!!

Great food and great ambiance  This little Italian restaurant caught us by surprise. The food is delicious as well as moderately priced. Our hostess was extremely attentive without being obtrusive. A delightful hostess. The staff was attentive as well. The only qualm I have about this place is that it seemed  the owner, or person in charge,  was quite agitated with a particular restaurant worker and vented his frustration in the middle of the restaurant. One would believe, it would be proper etiquette not to discuss conduct of business in front of customers.  Nonetheless, it shouldn't take away from the quality of food and the service provided by the staff.
Great service and the food was incredible! Prices were low and the ambiance was nice. Great Italian place.
Friendly staff at neighborhood  restaurant.
Excellent dishes from appetizers through dessert. Very pleasant and accommodating staff. Definitely worth going to.
Intimate, pretty space; friendly staff; fresh, tasty food; outdoor seating; reasonably priced. Def will return!
Love Piccoli. Amazing food and great wine. Cozy atmosphere.

My sister and I came here tonight for our first night in Brooklyn and what an amazing start to the summer in this city!! I cannot rave about the servers enough here, excellent service and recommendations for the menu. Amazing ambiance on the patio and inside! The food is to die for and not expensive for what you’re getting! We got the homemade gnocchi special and it was perfect! Filling enough but light enough for summer. If you’re new to the Brooklyn area this is a must try!
A different atmosphere
Great food, especially the homemade black pasta. Great wine and friendly, knowledgeable servers.

The owner is a very very nice and kind person. The place itself is very neat and fancy and is a great place to go out and eat. The food is amazing and delicious and presentable. Its one of my top favorite places. Mind you i never ate at a greek restaurant before. :)
Delicious home cooked, outstanding food and excellent staff.

Great food, great prices, but as other reviews say, the service was so poor that I will not go back.  As a few of the other reviews said, the difference in treatment from table to table is bazaar, and it’s hard to understand why service for the table next to us was so good while we were completely ignored beginning to end, to the point that they couldn’t find my credit card I had given them to pay for my meal, but before they temporarily lost my card, tables came after us, and left before us.  My friend thought maybe it was because we were both women, we really couldn’t make sense of it.
Amazing place. The food and the service are both excellent and prices are on point.
Food was excellent
Lively cozy place with gorgeous food and excellent staff. Pasta with cream sauce and wild mushrooms with a glass of Malbec; paradise found.

To this day, the meal that I had here is the best I have ever eaten. I started with the Bruschetta di parma, followed by the Anatra (seared duck) and finished with the vanilla bean gelato. INCREDIBLE!!! service was also great. Cant wait to go back!
I love Piccoli and have been making it a regular stop. Their pastas are delicious and you cant beat their brunch. The French toast is fantastic. Definitely stay for dessert- it is incredible!
Excellent meal and attentive but not intrusive service. Set menu was very good, both in terms of options and value. Would definitely return.
Tasty, very crowded
Friendly place good food good price
Cute. Authentic Italian atmosphere. I had grilled squids. Highly recommend! 😋
Excellent food, friendly service, but be prepared to wait for a table occasionally. Our top choice for Italian food in the Slope.
Hidden gem , love the atmosphere the food is always on point and you can order it the way you want. They make it all fresh and yummy. Never disappointed.
My go to local pasta spot. Portion sizes could be a little bigger but quality is top notch especially for the price! I haven't had one pasta there I didn't like!

Really delicious food and a nice cozy environment. I had a salad, and the gnocchi which they make there, both were delicious. The salad was fresh and light. The gnocchi was flavorful and perfectly salted.
The meat sauce 😁
The shrimp was bad
Good food.
Good food.
Superb authentic Italian cuisine

Piccolo is a small Italian restaurant with outstanding food and service.  Everytime my husband I visit New York, NY we eat at Piccoli for lunch or dinner each day during our visit!  Today we had a luncheon for 33 people to celebrate my mother-in-law's 96th birthday.  Everyone was impressed with the food quality and the friendliness and professionalism of the staff.  We love Piccoli!
Great food and Service....very nice

*Update - every time I come to NY, this place is a must for me! I'll be there in 2 weeks and my first food stop will be here! I love this place!  Food was amazing and fresh! Service was pretty good as well. I came 2 nights in a row, trying 2 different dishes/ wines, an neither time disappointed.

Stopped in here on a whim after a yoga class nearby. When dining alone I often sit at the bar as to not take up a table. I'm so glad I did because the bartender was so nice, she had great recommendations and made sure everything came out perfectly. I had salmon and honestly it was the best I've ever had. If you're nearby you gotta stop in, you'll love it.
(Translated by Google) Delicious Italian food in a very cozy place  (Original) Deliciosa comida italiana en un lugar muy acogedor
Great brunch and also has unlimited Mimosas, Bellinis or Bloody Marys for 90 min
The risotto is awesome. Okay, actually everything we've had there has been delicious.

Wanted to love this place but unfortunately was gravely disappointed. I'll start with the positives: my pasta was fantastic and the hostess upon entering was extremely pleasant on a Saturday night. The ambience is also nice. Now, the negatives: we were seated at a table for two inside. It was a busy night. After 15 minutes of no one taking our order for food (we had wine), we were asked if it was okay if we moved outside to accommodate a party of 12 that "had been waiting outside for 40 minutes".  We said "no problem". We moved outside. 20 minutes later, no order. 10 minutes later, no water. 50 minutes later, we get our food. Still no water or bread. My partner is a chef and there was something off with his crab and pasta dish. He couldn't eat it as he was afraid that he would get sick. While the staff was apologetic, they blamed everything on their new hostess.  The couple next to us also had a horrible experience. Seriously, somebody in this restaurant needs to train their staff properly. Our entire evening  meal was sort of ruined by this. We will never be going to Piccoli again. That is for sure - and it is a shame because this restaurant has so much potential.

My favorite Italian restaurant in Brooklyn! We absolutely love this place. Perfect for brunch, lunch and dinner. Food is amazing!!! My daughter loves pasta here, it’s only place where she eats bolognese.

I've been to many italian restaraunts in New York City, and this one was very good. The waiter was very welcoming, and even though I'm brown and seem young they still treated me nicely. The ravioli was amazing, and the buffalo mozzarella was sweet on the palette. The star dish however is the tiramisu, I will always come back here
Had the spaghetti calabrese last time, which was very good. I've had a few other dishes in the past and all of them were very good.

The people I came with have eaten here before and usually love it, but they weren’t thrilled this visit. My food was good, but nothing super special, as I expect short rib to be tasty and tender when I pay a chunk of money for it, and a grilled slab of polenta isn’t going to earn any extra rating stars. They nicely substituted veggies on a couple of plates for other veggie dishes that work d better for us. The service was good, it was attentive and friendly but not rushed. They have patio seating so you can have a dog with you, which was nice. The sake mojito was underwhelming—I didn’t get much mojito flavor, and it was more like a watery, iced sake, heavy on the ice. They have a bunch of dessert options, but none really appealed so we skipped it.
Yummy food, nice staff, comfortable ambience.
Great food and very friendly service!

I can't say enough good things about this place. If you're looking for delicious, authentic Italian food, this is your place. Great service, great atmopshere, and incredible food. I highly recommend the ravioli di caprino.
Awesome. Delicious.
Always great food and great service, bon appetite!
Amazing flavors and quality food. You almost feel like your in Florence by the quaint ambiance and simple yet flavorful food.
Terrific food and great location.

This is my go to. The pasta is always great and the staff there is so nice. The brunch is DELICIOUS. This place knows how to make french toast. Outside seating. Tiny bathroom. Very likely that you will sit directly next to another table.
First time here, Good food and service, will come back again..

I had a really great, memorable experience here. I came here on a Sunday night around 7 pm with a friend. There was no wait, and we were seated immediately. Their wine prices were very reasonable, ~$9 per glass of wine. I ordered the risotto nero, squid ink risotto with calamari. It was very delicious. The atmosphere of the restaurant was very romantic and cozy, and they have outdoor seating too. Our server was also extremely friendly. I would definitely come again for dinner.

Food was fantastic, even for the area, but the service was just terrible. Even though the servers were nice, we were left waiting for thirty minutes at a time before someone came to our table to pick up our plates. Over thirty minutes for the check, and the restaurant had about three servers and six (two-person) tables - there's no reason for that kind of wait. Of course, once I set down the money, someone came over IMMEDIATELY to ask if I needed change. The service makes it not worth going back.
Good atmosphere and excellent service and food
Absolutely Superb! The food was first rate and the service was efficient and friendly. Can't wait to return and explore more of the menu.
Reliably outstanding food.  Try the Bolognese or the Funghi pasta.
Unfortunately, the service proved to be more impactful than the food.  After making a 7:45 reservation we were not sat until almost 9pm.  The food was fine, just not worth the wait.
Wow, just phenomenal Italian food. Great selection of wines. Cozy atmosphere.

I only been to brunch, but the entire experience was fabulous. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive.  The restaurant is bright with lots of windows, but still very cozy. I loved the ceiling and chandeliers. The food was also incredible. We had French Toast, bacon, and Heuvos Rancheros. The presentation and taste were excellent - the bacon was super crunchy without being burnt, the French Toast came with just the right amount of maple syrup already on it, and the Heuvos Rancheros were perfect. We also got the unlimited drinks. I had  Bellinis and my friend had Mimosas. The drinks are freshly made and arrive frequently. I can't wait to go back and try dinner.
I chose to have my wedding party here. This place is amazing.
Excellent Italian at reasonable prices. Highly recommend.  The Risottos are worth the 20 minute wait.
Risotto was delicious
Yummy.Very attentive service.
Excellent attention and good variety

Fun, intimate little Brooklyn restaurant. The food was good, although the rolls with cold marinara was weird and not the best. The appetizers were pretty good and the pasta was just good. Maybe, because it was a slow night they weren’t on their A game. I will say though, service was great and the staff was very friendly.
Good, but a little expensive
I had a chicken soup and seafood risotto. Both dishes are great and delicious. The service is also fine.
Solid Italian pastas.  The bolognese is my favorite.
Good place for Italian food. Everything we ordered was delicious.
Always love this friendly neighborhood restaurant, which I think is one of the best Italian restaurant in the city.
(Translated by Google) This is the best Italian restaurant in Brooklyn  (Original) Questo è il migliore ristorante italiano in Brooklyn
Great place for a date. Some of the most amazing pasta dishes you will ever find. Try them all!!
Visited this place all the way from Houston TX, it was awesome. Exceeded expectations. Good price, better quality.
I had the Risotto Ai Frutti Di Mare. It was cooked to perfection, not to mention a wonderful ambiance.
Great place, delicious food and awesome service.
Great homemade pasta
Another fantastic meal from my favorite Italian bistro.
I'm not someone who generally writes online reviews, but I had to for Piccoli. This place might actually be the best restaurant in Park Slope. Squid ink pasta is really great.
Good food. Good service.
very dirty
I took my mom here for her birthday, it was amazing! The pastas we're so fresh with very original flavor profiles. Highly recommend.
Make sure, you have a reservation! The place is always crowded, but it worth it!
Favorite Italian restaurant in Brooklyn by far!! Also their French toast for brunch keeps me coming back for more. Love it!

Pasta with mushroom sauce was amazing! Definitely will try other dishes! And service is the best ! ( about comment below from Claudia Corona  , she saying that leave bad reviews rarely, hah! Look at her all reviews that she gave, 4 of her all 6  reviews are bad 😁)

Food not too bad although black spaghetti with crab was salty. Glass of red wine spilled on one in our party. No move to take it off the bill, free dessert or offer to pay a cleaning bill etc., just some water to wipe it off. We complained after the bill was paid, but other than "sorry", no action.

I rarely write bad reviews and hate to do it, but we had such a disastrous experience that I feel I have no choice. Also, Let me preface this by saying it has taken me forever to write this review, so hopefully things have changed since our experience... OK so we went out for a date night, we were hoping for a nice and relaxing night. Well it absolutely did not turn out that way. First of all we asked to some of the staff if we can sat outside and he said that they had a reservation, which was ok because we did not have reservation. We ate and we left and no one was on the table. After that Marta or something like that approached us to take us the order (i think she was  our server, at this point I don't know who was)   that was the first time that we saw her in our table  and the second was when she gave us the bill, these was only two times that we saw her., we saw her the whole moment showing photos of her new baby but never doing her job.  Anyway , We ordered an amazing salad and pasta, the food was more than good. Also we ordered a rose wine which tasted old and a perroni.  Then, the food came on time but when we wanted to order more drinks there was no one to order,  so ok it happens. but then we tried to order a dessert we really love tiramisu but again there were no one to take the order, until the buss boy came, he was the person who said to some one of the server staff that we wanted a dessert. Then the tiramisu came and was totally beautiful although we waited for spoons around 15minutes and we just got the spoons because we remind to the person who gave us the dessert that we need it. While we were eating our dessert we cleaned the rest of the utensils and we put it on the table next to us, then three persons came in so the same server that gave us the tiramisu and forgot the spoons for 15 min, he gave those people  the table next to us but some  that was very rude from his part was telling us if we can clean our dirty utensils, he  even did't ask  if we need it or something coordial, he just said "these are your things? can you move it please?" so i was very very disappointed. I am going to be very clear about why we are very disappointed , While we were eating there were two more persons who we don't know if were servers or something but they just forgot our table, they weren't busy because was around 3:30pm on Sunday, there was just 4 tables and 4 people of the staff, they were just hanging and showing baby pictures, when we asked for utensils, water, drinks and dessert they were very very rude, with attitude  and unprofessional.Completely unacceptable. At the end we just gave tip  to the busboy who was the only person that was nice and professional. Honestly seems like this place needs someone that knows customer service and how to run a restaurant. We been here before a couple of times because we live in Park slope, definitely we are not coming back, we thought order delivery because we love the food but we don't know yet. Park slope has  a very good italian places piccoli used to be one of them, but unfortunately it is no anymore.
Amazing food and staff. Everything is cooked on the spot.
We had a lovely dinner. The food was amazing and the staff very welcoming. We will definitely come back. Such a great restaurant.
Bruschetta di Parmi was awesome as was everything else we had, the roasted corn and avocado salad and the risotto with butternut squash.
Nice casual family style place. Great staff.

I love this place so much! My boyfriend and I constantly order in but going out to eat in the restaurant is also a lovely experience. Their bread is delicious and crunchy. The risotto is by far my favorite! Also the kale side and Brussels Sprouts side are amazing.
delicious! make sure you have a reservation.
Delicious home-cooked Italian food, and friendly wait staff. My favorites include: eggplant rigatoni, homemade rolls, salad with roasted corn, and olive oil cake!

0 for 2.  Two times we tried to get a table for two, for an early dinner, and two times we were told it would be a two hour wait...when the entire restaurant was 3/4 empty. What gives?? Happily went to a place down the street which was more crowded and sat us immediately.
Paparadelle with short-rib ragu!
They serve proper Italian food made on premises. Service is good the prices are moderate. The place is a little bit old school.
Good food, good service. Solid and reliable.

There are about a hundred Italian restaurants in Park Slope and I think I've tried them all. None of them come close to Piccoli Trattoria. Me and my friend go there about once a month because it is so amazing. The pasta actually tastes like it was just made, because it was, I've asked. The sauces are delicious, clearly not from a jar. If I had to recommend something on the menu, it would be the spicy squid ink pasta with shrimp and chorizo. It's my favorite and usually is what I get. In addition, the prices are super reasonable for the area, with pasta dishes running you in the teens. Finally, the place is amazing, it's a tiny little hole in the wall, and a real find!

Came here for my birthday dinner and everything was amazing from start to finish! The two salads we ordered were fresh, light, and delicious. The calamari was amazingly tasty and soft, and had the whole table wanting a second order. We also ordered a pasta each (and 1 risotto) and everything was so good! I had the ravioli with butternut squash, it was so good I had about 3 stolen. But I made up for it by finishing my thiefs risotto. After, we ordered dessert and it was crazy good. The panna cotta was the perfect consistency, and the olive oil cake was bursting with flavor. All in all, everything was fresh, delicious, and amazing. I honestly can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu!

Best pasta I've had outside of Italy and the duck and squid is cooked to perfection. This place is a gem, tucked away on 6th ave. Lovely staff, amazing food- wish there were more than 5 starts to give em!
Delicious food and wonderful service. Try the risotto de nero, it's my favorite dish on the menu. Also some of the best tiramisu in or out of Italy.
homemade pasta is delicious
Very good food, especially the calamari appetizer.
It was out first time there and it was a great experience. The food was delicious, service was great and as soon as we walked in the door we were acknowledged and treated.
This is a fantastic place. Fresh pasta, amazing butternut squash, great service, and much more. Best Italian I've ever had. Would be hard to go wrong with Piccoli Trattoria!
Everything was delicious. The place was adorable. I'm in love with the guy I dined with. My new favorite place!
Best homemade pasta!
Intimate and great cooking. My friends and I come here for great food and good times. Highlight of the night was a group of Christmas carollers came in and sang a few songs!

This is probably one of the best meals I've ever had.  I am from out of town, and so lucky to find this gem. Try the butternut squash ravioli!!! I never take the time to write reviews, but this place deserves it.
Quaint and lovely ambience. Awesome food
Great low key place with reasonable prices and excellent food!
A great ambiance.  Terrific food.  Great neighborhood place....not a noisy busy place.

Now *this* is what 4+ star restaurant should be, not just a crowded beer bar serving bland hot dogs.  Four of us tried Piccoli Trattoria and it was everything we hoped it would be.  I usually like to offer a little bit of criticism in my positive reviews if only so as not to sound like a ringer or the owner's brother.  But I really can't in this case. Everything was terrific: the food, the wine selection, the service, the unpretentious bistro decor.  After reading a few of the reviews here I was expecting at least an overwhelmed dining room staff with it being Saturday night and all but they knocked it out of the park there too,  If anything, the service was a tad over-attentive... and there it is, my requisite little piece of grousing.  The pastas were fresh and original and the meats were terrific and substantially sized. The sides were large and very tasty (I loved the grilled brussels sprouts and calamari salad).  The desserts were scrumptious. You will not walk out of this place hungry, which is more than can be said about a lot of the new restaurants hitting this neighborhood.  We will be back, and soon.
Food is pretty good.
Best ragu in the city. So reasonably priced, too. Thank you and never change!
Unpretentious and delicious Italian restaurant frequented by locals. Friendly and attentive service. Reasonable prices for quality food. Get the pappardelle and thank me later.

This is one of my favorite spots in Park Slope. I've been here 3 times now in the past few months. It can be a bit crowded and the wait time is up there, but what can you expect when the food is monumentally phenomenal. The appetizers are first rate, especially the Arcobaleno. I highly recommend!
This is a small intimate place with great service. We had mela, spaghetti al granchio and a steak. I really enjoyed my spaghetti and it definitely had a strong spicy kick to it.

Very good Italian food; they get you in and out pretty fast. Extremely packed, feels like you are on top of your neighbor. House wine rates a 2 or 3. Overall, if you are craving a quick Italian meal, it is a a decent place.
Slow, but GREAT food,  and at a surprisingly good price. Definitely recommended.
They  have very delicious pasta and risotto, however the food is too oily and creamy.

Some of my friends recommended me to go there for a while. So, I finally made it over recently. It is located in the quiet area of the Park Slope. Good Italian restaurants are usually owned and operated by a huband and wife. And it was absolutely true to this restaurant with real authentic Italian food. It was a real deal.  I especially enjoyed the seafood black squid pasta and grilled calamari . Please try them when you go there for the first time. They served Mahattan quality food with Broooklyn price.  I highly recommend this restaurant.
Casual place, rather small, several tables outside, quiet leafy corner, delicious pasta.
Love this place, sit outside and lap up some wonderful pasta or risotto with a glass of wine. Mela salad was excellent and I can't go here and not order the grilled squid.
My favorite Italian restaurant. Anything on the menu is delicious.
The pasta is ridiculously awesome!

This is my favorite place in Park Slope. The pasta is always good and the prices are OK.  The prices are great for the quality.  My husband loves the squid ink pasta.  I'm not a fan but I am told it is about as good as you can get anywhere.
Had dinner here. Place is small and intimate. Not pretentious at all. Totally good spaghetti. He had spaghetti al granchio. I had paparelle.
The leek and sausage risotto is delicious! And this coming from someone who isn't crazy about risotto. Looking forward to more delicious meals.
Delicious food. Great setting. Great service.

Excellent food in tiny space. Hostess was poor at estimating how long the wait would be however. I recognize this is a tricky art, requiring one part crystal ball, but if we had had a realistic estimate we would have gone elsewhere and tried another time. Food was superb, but probably not worth 90 minute wait walking in circles around the nabe, though we finally got in.
Great food, very pleasant staff and a quaint atmosphere. 5 stars easily.
The food was superb.  Service was excellent. Very small and quaint restaurant. Great wine, atmosphere, and food.
The food was delicious. All made fresh!
Great food, great service, the best tiramisu ever!!! No complaints...
My favorite Italian in the big Apple
Best Italian in BK.
so good!
Love this place.
Small, packed place with really good Italian food. The Mela salad and butternut squash risotto were really good!
Small, very good Italian restaurant, with delicious and well made food, without being fussy or overly expensive. Staff are great, and the daily risotto and gnocchi specials are always a solid bet.

What an amazing place.  I've been going to Piccoli regularly over the last year, and haven't had a bad meal yet.  Busy during rush, certainly.  But the food is uniformly spectacular.  I might have to give up on pasta elsewhere; this place is so much better.
great experience, we are now regular customers. The owner is very nice and know what Italian food is about. I higlhy recommend this restaurant
Excellent italian, always accommodating, excellent food.
Very good cuisine made out of fresh produce. Highly recommend this place.

As a user below described, this really is a "hidden gem."  Tucked away on the less trafficked 6th avenue, Picolli serves up some seriously good risotto.  Their salads and appetizers are also notable.  Personally, I really enjoy their brussel sprout salad.  Have eaten many risotto dishes here, all of which I highly enjoyed.  The service is always great and everyone has a friendly disposition.  I always leave here feeling good.  Seating is very limited so call ahead.
Great ambiance and innovative Italian cuisine. Attentive and friendly staff.
